cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi NE of Cozumel, Mexico, near the Yucatan Channel

motion.direction: Stationary (expected to begin drifting north Monday)

cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move slowly north into the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then accelerate northeast toward Florida’s Big Bend, cross the Southeast U.S. and move off or near the North Carolina coast late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for the U.S. coastline yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for the U.S. coastline yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend through coastal Georgia and the Carolinas (including Cape Fear region)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (depending on exact track, 2–4+ inches are plausible)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤8%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions more likely than damaging winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible if the center tracks closer, but significant surge not indicated
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain late Wednesday–Thursday could cause localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado threat in outer rainbands cannot be ruled out during closest approach
